D662210-d-10-29-10-ABS.Narrative: ABSR112-28 WAS SWITCHING GORDO FEED MILL.  CUT OFF FROM TRAIN EAST OF INDUSTRY, AND PULLED CARS UP THE MIN LINE AND RAN AROUND CARS.  NOTE THIS INDUSTRY OPENS TO THE EAST ONLY.  ENGINEER STAYED ON WEST LEAD MOTOR AND DID NOT SWAP ENDS; CONDUCTOR PROTECTED SHOVES.  SPOTTED THE 7 LOADS OF CORN TO THE701 CORN UPPER TRACK, AND WAS REVERSING MOVEMENT OUT TOWARD MAIN LINE.  AS THE WAMX 4118 LEAD TRUCKCAME INTO THE TURNOUT SECTION, THE R1 WHEEL DERAILED AT THE JOINT WHERE THE LH STOCK CONNECTS WITH THE CLOSURE RAIL.  IT THEN PROCEEDED TO ROLL THE OUTSIDE (SOUTH) RAIL ALL THE WAY OUT TO THE ABS MAINLINE SWITCH.  THE WAMX 3813 MIDDLE UNIT, FOLLOWED AND DERAILED AS WELL.  AS THE WAMX 4118 PASSED OVER THE GUARDRAIL TO THE ABS MAIN TRACK SWITCH, THE GUARD RAIL ROLLED UP, BROKE, AND SLICED OPEN THEFUEL TANK WITH A 10 FT X 10 IN WIDE GASH, IMMEDIATELY SPILLING ALL 2500 GALLONS OF FUEL DOWN THE EMBANKMENT INTO A BEAVER POND WETLAND.  PLEASE NOTE THE POD AND WHERE THE WAMX 4116 LEAD TRUCK FINALLYSTOPPED WAS 130 FEET.  CONDUCTOR STATED HE WAS PROTECTING THE POINT, AND ADVISED ENGINEER TO STOP WHEN DERAILMENT OCCURED.  INVESTIGATION ONSITE WAS CONDUCTEDPOD FOUND AS STATED ABOVE IS AT LH STOCK RAIL AND CLOSURE RAIL.  NOTE THIS IS A 90 LB #8 SWITCH AND IS NOT EQUIPPED WITH HEEL BLOCKS- WITH THIS DESIGN THERE ARE NO EFFECTIVE FASTENERS ON THE FIELD SIDE OF THE CLOSURE RAIL 36 INCHES WEST OF THE JOINT, AND THE SWITCH STOP IS 36" EAST OF THE JOINT.  TIES IN GOOD CONDITION, GAGE MEASURED 57 1/2

D542610-d-10-01-10-TIBR.Narrative: THE 222 JASPER TURN PULLED 89 CARS OUT OF 107 TO HANG THE REAR END DEVICE, AND THEN SHOVED TO CLEAROF THE WORKING LEAD.  THE CONDUCTOR HUNG THE REAR END DEVICE AND RODE THE SHOVE TO A STOP APPROXIMATELY 2.5 CAR LENGHTS FROM THE DERAIL ON THE WEST END OF 107.  AFTER MOVEMENT WAS STOPPED THE CONDUCTOR CALLED FOR A SET AND RELEASED THE HANDBRAKES ON THE TRAIN, THEN PROCEEDED TO WALK THE SET.  AFTERTHE CONDUCTOR VERIFED THE SET, HE PROCEEDED TO LINE THEM OUT AND INSTRUCTED THE ENGINEER TO RELEASETHE BRAKES.  AFTER THE BRAKES RELEASED THE SLACK ROLLED OUT CAUSING THE REAR TRUCKS OF THE 89TH CARTO ROLL OVER THE DERAIL.  THE 222 PULLED THE TRAIN OUT OF THE YARD, AND THE DERAILED CAR RERAILED ON106 SWITCH FROG. CONDUCTOR VISIBILY INSPECTED THE RELEASE AND DID NOT SEE THE DERAILED CAR AS IT RERAILED PRIOR TO THE REAR CAR PASSING HIS LOCATION.

QR47018-d-10-19-10-SGSC.Narrative: THE SWITCH CREW WAS ATTEMPTING TO PULL CARS FROM THE INDUSTRIAL FACILITY, THE TOTAL CARS TO BE PULLED WAS 44 CARS, THE CARS WERE STAGED ON 2 SEPARATE TRACKS (8 &12). THE CREW SUCCESSFULLY PULLED 21 CARS FROM TRACK 8 AND DOUBLED OVER TO TRACK 12 TO PULL THE REMAINING CARS. AFTER COUPLING AND CHARGINGTHE AIR SYSTEM THE LOCOMOTIVES (GMTX 2000 & 2002) WERE UNABLE TO PULL THE ENTIRE STRING OF 44 LOADED CARS. THE DECISION WAS MADE TO MAKE A CUT AT CAR 26, PULL THESE CARS, WITH THE INTENTION OF RETURNING LATER TO PULL THE REMAINING 18 CARS. THE BRAKEMAN MOUNTED THE "B" END OF CAR 27 AND SET A HAND BRAKE. HE THEN WALKED BACK TO THE "A" END AND MISTAKENLY CLOSED THE ANGLE COCK ON CAR 27 (BOTTLING THE AIR). THE BRAKEMAN THEN REQUESTED A BUMP OF THE STRING TO ALLOW THE RELEASE OF THE COUPLER PIN, THE CARS WERE BUMPED, THE PIN WAS RELEASED AND THE TRAIN PULLED AWAY. WHEN THE AIR HOSES SEPARATED THETRAIN LOST AIR PRESSURE AND THE BRAKES WERE PUT INTO EMERGENCY APPLICATION. AT THAT POINT THE BRAKEMAN REALIZED THAT HE HAD CLOSED THE WRONG ANGLE COCK AND OBSERVED THE STRING OF CARS THAT WERE NOT ATTACHED TO THE LOCOMOTIVE ROLLING AWAY. THE GRADE OF TRACK 12 IS APPROXIMATELY 4%, THE CARS ACCELERATED QUICKLY AND THE BRAKEMAN WAS UNABLE TO CATCH THEM. THE 18 CARS ROLLED THROUGH A CLOSED CHAIN LINK FENCE GATE CONTINUED TO ROLL AND IMPACTED AN EARTHEN BERM, CHVX 890297 PASSED COMPLETELY THROUGH THE BERM WITH ALL 4 AXLES DERAILING, THE TRAILING CAR CHVX 889466 ALSO DERAILED ONE AXLE SET. RAILROA

686962-d-10-16-10-IC.Remote Control Locomotive: Remote control portable transmitter - more than one remote control transmitter
686962-d-10-16-10-IC.Narrative: REMOTE JOB, RCL91771-16 WAS PERFORMING HUMPING OPERATIONS IN HARRISON YARD. THE CREW HUMPED TWO CARSINTO TRACK M0-16 AND THEN HUMPED  TWO CARS INTO TRACK M0-15. THE CARS HUMPED INTO TRACK M0-16 DID NOT CLEAR AND THE TWO CARS DESTINED INTO TRACK M0-15 SIDE SWIPED THE CARS THAT DID NOT CLEAR INTO TRACK M0-16. THERE WERE FOUR CARS INVOLVED ALL DANGEROUS RESIDUE CARS; GATX 61822, TILX 600154, SHPX 240415 AND SHPX 240412. THERE WERE NO LEAKS OR EXPOSURE AND NO CARS DERAILED. INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT FOUND THAT THE HPCS SYSTEM HAS TWO OS CIRCUITS PER TRACK FOLLOWED BY A CLEARANCE TRACK CIRCUIT BEGINNING AT THE SWITCH OF THE CLASSIFICATION TRACK. THE HPCS SYSTEM WILL NOT ALLOW THE SWITCHESTO LINE WHILE IT DETECTS CARS IN EITHER OF OS CIRCUITS. HOWEVER, ONCE A CAR CLEARS THE OS TRACK CIRCUIT AND ENTERS THE CLEARANCE TRACK, A 30 TO 50 SECONDS DELAY IS ALLOWED BEFORE THE HPCS SYSTEM DECLARES A CORNERING SITUATION AND APPLIES CORNERING PROTECTION TO THE TRACK. THIS TIME IS CALCULATED BYTHE SPEED MEASUREMENT OF THE HPCS SYSTEM AND VARIES FROM CAR TO CAR AND TRACK TO TRACK. THE HPCS SYSTEM HAD INADEQUATE TIME TO PROVIDE CORNERING PROTECTION AND GIVE NOTIFICATION TO YARDMASTER.

10172010-d-10-17-10-SNJX.Narrative: AT APPROXIMATELY 15:41 ON SUNDAY 17 OCTOBER 2010, SOUTHBOUND TRAIN #278, LRV 3515 REPORTED STRIKINGA DOWNED TREE AT RR MP 24.8 RESULTING IN FRONT END DAMAGES TO LRV INCLUDING DISABLING DAMAGE TO THELRV COUPLER ASSEMBLY. TRAIN MOVEMENT IN THE AREA WAS SUSPENDED AND A BUS BRIDGE BETWEEN ROEBLING ANDBORDENTOWN STATIONS WAS ESTABLISHED. NO INJURIES WERE REPORTED BY THE LRV OPERATOR. 2 PASSENGERS, OF THE 34 ON THE BOARD THE LRV, REPORTED NECK/BACK INJURIES AND A KNEE INJURY AS A RESULT OF THE COLLISION WITH THE TREE. THE 2 PASSENGERS REQUESTED MEDICAL ASSISTANCE. RIVER LINE TRACK AND SIGNAL STAFF REMOVED THE TREE FROM THE AREA TO FACILITATE RESPONSE EFFORTS. DUE TO THE REMOTENESS OF THE AREA IN WHICH THE INCIDENT OCCURRED, A SECOND NON-REVENUE LRV WAS BROUGHT TO THE ADJACENT TRACK AND ALL OFTHE PASSENGERS ON BOARD THE DISABLED LRV WERE EVACUATED INTO THE ROW TO BOARD THE SECOND TRAIN. THEEVACUATION TOOK PLACE AT 16:18 AND WAS CONDUCTED UNDER THE SUPERVISION OF THE CREW MEMBERS AND NJ TRANSIT POLICE. THE SECOND TRAIN PROCEEDED TO BORDENTOWN STATION FOR REMOVAL OF ALL PASSENGERS ON BOARD ARRIVING AT THE STATION AT 16:28. THE PASSENGERS REPORTING INJURY WERE REMOVED FROM THE BORDENTOWN STATION FOR EXAMINATION BY EMS. TO DATE, NO PASSENGER HAS BEEN ADMITTED TO THE HOSPITAL FOR TREATMENT. BASED UPON THE EVACUATION OF THE DISABLED TRAIN, THIS INCIDENT MET THE REQUIREMENTS FOR TELEPHONIC NOTIFICATION TO THE NRC. NRC REPORT #957263 WAS FILED.

686876-d-10-15-10-GTW.Narrative: M38731-15 WAS NEGOTIATING THE CP SCOTTEN INTERLOCKING ON THE CORNIAL SHARED ASSETS WHEN THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY. THE CONDUCTOR WALKED BACK AND FOUND CARS FTTX 961363 AND FTTX 972047 DERAILED INBETWEEN THE CROSSOVER SWITCHES WITHIN THE CP SCOTTEN INTERLOCKING. INVESTIGATION REVEALED THAT FTTX961363 HAD DERAILED FIRST AT THE APEX OF THE 16 DEGREE CURVE COMING SOUTH INTO THE CP SCOTTEN INTERLOCKING. A DOWNLOAD OF THE LEAD UNIT REVEALED THAT THE ENGINEER WAS THROTTLING UP TO NORTH #3 SIX MINUTES BEFORE THE INCIDENT. THIS ACTION EFFECTIVELY STRETCHED THE RAIL OUT. AT THREE MINUTES PRIOR, HEAPPLIED THE INDEPENDENT BRAKES AND SHORTLY THEREAFTER A MINIMUM SERVICE AIR BRAKE APPLICATION. WHENTHE AIR BRAKES WERE APPLIED HE FAILED TO BAIL-OFF THE INDEPENDENT, ALLOWING IT TO BUILD TO 21 PSI.THIS CAUSED THE HEAD-END TO BEGIN BUNCHING WHILE THE REAR-END RAN IN. CONRAIL ESTIMATED $38,700 IN TRACK DAMAGE.

688172-d-10-25-10-IC.Narrative: R91191-25 REPORTED A DAMAGED CAR IN A CUT THAT THEY HAD PULLED OUT TO SWITCH. THE DAMAGED CAR WAS TCIX 3925, RESIDUE TANK OF FERTILIZER. THE CAR HAD A BENT COUPLER CENTER SILL. THIS IS A TANK CAR WITHTHE STUB CENTER SILL ON EACH END. THE SILL WAS BENT IN A DOWNWARD POSITION AND COUPLED TO OTHER CARS ON EACH END WHEN THE ASSIGNMENT PULLED THE TRACK OUT TO SWITCH. UPON INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT IT WAS DETERMINED THAT R91191-25 HAD BEEN SWITCHING FROM THE SOUTH END OF C-YARD. THEY LEFT TCIX3925 SOUTH OUT IN TRACK CC07 APPROXIMATELY 15 CARS DEEP INTO THE TRACK. THE CREW THEN KICKED 5 CARSTO TRACK CC06 AT 8 MPH. THEN THEY KICKED 6 LOADED CARS BACK INTO TRACK CC07 AGAINST THE TANK CAR CAUSING THE DAMAGE. THE LOCOMOTIVE TAPES SHOWED THAT THE CARS WERE CUT OFF IN MOTION AT 13 MPH. THERE WAS DERAILMENT OR TRACK DAMAGE BUT TCIX 3925 SUSTAINED SILL DAMAGE. CREW RELEASED CARS AT AN EXCESSIVE COUPLING SPEED AND ALSO RELEASED 6 LOADS EVEN THOUGH THE SUPERINTENDENT'S BULLETIN #26 STATED NO MORE THAN 5 LOADED CARS CAN BE CUT IN MOTION AT ONE TIME IN THE SAME TRACK.

686786-d-10-14-10-WC.Narrative: L50191-14 WAS IN THE PROCESS OF SWITCHING INDUSTRIES OFF THE RICH PRODUCTS LEAD. THE CREW HAD PULLED3 CARS, TIED BACK ONTO THEIR TRAIN AND WERE SHOVING TO SPOT LOADS AT 2 DIFFERENT INDUSTRIES. AS THEY WERE SHOVING DOWN THE HILL TO THE INDUSTRY, THE HIGH-SIDE RAIL ROLLED UNDER CAR BNSF 450388 CAUSING THE TRAILING TRUCK TO DERAIL AND ROLL ALONG ON THE WEB OF THE RAIL CAUSING THE FOLLOWING 3 CARS TODERAIL. DERAILED LOADS: BNSF 450388, BNSF 450782, ECUX 880577, AND HHCX 35831. NO INJURIES AND NO HAZARDOUS COMMODITIES ARE INVOLVED.

WHEN THE CREW BEGAN TO PULL NORTH ON THE IPS, ONE WHEEL ON RAILCAR FURX 830041DROPPED OUTSIDE THE RAIL DUE TO BROKEN RAIL.  THE WHEEL TRAVELED NORTH ON THE TIES FOR APPROXIMATELY 1100 FEET UNTIL IT STRUCK A PRIVATE CROSSING, WHICH CAUSED THE DERAILMENT OF RAILCARS FURX 830041AND FURX 821429.  MIDAMERICAN ENERGY MAINTAINS TRACK.
